back_cards.definition_en: Relating to the sun as a source of energy
back_cards.example_en: The house uses solar panels to generate electricity.
Solar flares can disrupt satellite communications.

back_cards.definition_en: Involving the sun in a scientific context
back_cards.example_en: The observatory studies solar activity daily.
She charged her phone with a solar charger during the camping trip.
The painting featured a solar glow in the sky.
She filed a complaint about the poor service at the restaurant.
The customer submitted a complaint to the manager.

back_cards.definition_en: A minor health issue expressed as discomfort
back_cards.example_en: He visited the doctor with a complaint of back pain.

back_cards.definition_en: An expression of annoyance in daily life
back_cards.example_en: Her constant complaint was the noisy neighbors.

back_cards.definition_en: A written or verbal objection in a workplace
back_cards.example_en: The employee’s complaint about overtime was ignored.

back_cards.definition_en: Having the ability to perform a task
back_cards.example_en: She is capable of solving complex math problems.

back_cards.definition_en: Skilled or competent in a job
back_cards.example_en: The team hired a capable engineer for the project.
He proved capable during the emergency response.
The young athlete is capable of winning the race.

back_cards.definition_en: Possessing the qualities for a role
back_cards.example_en: She’s capable of leading the committee effectively.
The scientist will analyze the experiment’s results tomorrow.
She needs to analyze the budget before deciding.

back_cards.definition_en: To break down information for understanding
back_cards.example_en: The teacher asked students to analyze the poem’s meaning.

back_cards.definition_en: To evaluate performance in a workplace
back_cards.example_en: The manager will analyze the team’s productivity this week.
Detectives analyze evidence to solve crimes.
The child was scared during the thunderstorm.
She felt scared before her first public speech.
He was scared when the car swerved suddenly.
They were scared about the exam results.
The loud noise left everyone scared in the room.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who backs a cause
back_cards.example_en: She’s a strong supporter of environmental policies.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who cheers for a team
back_cards.example_en: The soccer supporter cheered loudly at the match.
He was her biggest supporter during tough times.

back_cards.definition_en: A contributor to a charity or project
back_cards.example_en: The museum gained a new supporter for its exhibit.

back_cards.definition_en: An advocate for a political candidate
back_cards.example_en: Supporters gathered to hear the candidate’s speech.

back_cards.definition_en: To break up or move soil
back_cards.example_en: They dig a hole to plant the tree.
She loves to dig through old records for history projects.
Archaeologists dig at the site for ancient artifacts.

back_cards.definition_en: To work hard on a task
back_cards.example_en: He needs to dig into his homework tonight.
I really dig the new song on the radio.
She bought twenty apples for the party.
The store sold twenty chairs in one day.
He’s in his twenty and starting a new career.
The room is twenty feet long.

back_cards.definition_en: A score or amount in games
back_cards.example_en: The team scored twenty points in the match.

back_cards.definition_en: To act as if something is true
back_cards.example_en: The kids pretend to be astronauts in the backyard.

back_cards.definition_en: To imagine in a playful context
back_cards.example_en: She likes to pretend she’s a chef while cooking.

back_cards.definition_en: To fake an emotion or action
back_cards.example_en: He had to pretend to be happy at the event.

back_cards.definition_en: To role-play in a social setting
back_cards.example_en: They pretend to be detectives during the game.
The actor will pretend to cry in the scene.

back_cards.definition_en: The study of knowledge and existence
back_cards.example_en: She studies philosophy at the university.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of beliefs or principles
back_cards.example_en: His philosophy is to live simply and honestly.

back_cards.definition_en: A way of thinking about life
back_cards.example_en: The coach’s philosophy focuses on teamwork.
Philosophy classes discuss ethics and logic.
Her philosophy on work prioritizes balance.

back_cards.definition_en: The period of being a child
back_cards.example_en: Her childhood was filled with happy memories.
He often talks about his childhood on the farm.

back_cards.definition_en: A time of learning and play
back_cards.example_en: Childhood is a time for exploring new things.
She missed the carefree days of her childhood.
His childhood shaped his love for music.
They lower the flag at sunset every day.

back_cards.definition_en: To reduce in amount or degree
back_cards.example_en: The store will lower prices during the sale.
Please lower your voice in the library.

back_cards.definition_en: To diminish in rank or status
back_cards.example_en: The company decided to lower his position.
She tried to lower her stress by meditating.

back_cards.definition_en: A large amount of money or assets
back_cards.example_en: His wealth came from years of smart investments.
The country’s wealth lies in its natural resources.
The town’s wealth grew after the new factory opened.
She values the wealth of knowledge she gained.
The entrepreneur built her wealth through innovation.

back_cards.definition_en: Government aid for those in need
back_cards.example_en: The family relies on welfare to cover expenses.

back_cards.definition_en: Well-being or health of a person
back_cards.example_en: The school promotes the welfare of its students.
The program aims to improve public welfare.
The organization focuses on animal welfare.
Welfare helped her get back on her feet.

back_cards.definition_en: The state of being extremely poor
back_cards.example_en: Many families in the area live in poverty.
Poverty forced him to skip meals sometimes.
Education can help lift people out of poverty.
The charity works to reduce poverty in the city.
Poverty made it hard to afford medical care.

back_cards.definition_en: A lawyer who represents the state in court
back_cards.example_en: The prosecutor presented evidence against the defendant.

back_cards.definition_en: A legal official in criminal cases
back_cards.example_en: She works as a prosecutor in the district court.
The prosecutor argued for a tough sentence.
The prosecutor questioned the witness thoroughly.

back_cards.definition_en: An attorney in a public office
back_cards.example_en: He was hired as a prosecutor last year.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to the soul or spirit
back_cards.example_en: She finds peace in spiritual meditation.
The festival has a deep spiritual meaning.
His spiritual journey shaped his outlook.
The book explores spiritual themes of hope.
The retreat offers a spiritual escape from stress.
The company plans to double its production.

back_cards.definition_en: To serve two purposes or roles
back_cards.example_en: The sofa can double as a guest bed.

back_cards.definition_en: To multiply a quantity by two
back_cards.example_en: She decided to double the recipe for the party.

back_cards.definition_en: To fold or bend something over
back_cards.example_en: He had to double the paper to fit it in.

back_cards.definition_en: To act as a substitute or stand-in
back_cards.example_en: The actor will double for the star in the scene.

back_cards.definition_en: To assess or judge the value
back_cards.example_en: The teacher will evaluate the students’ projects.
The manager needs to evaluate the team’s progress.
She will evaluate the car before buying it.
Scientists evaluate the data from experiments.

back_cards.definition_en: To appraise in a professional context
back_cards.example_en: The appraiser will evaluate the house’s value.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to the country of Israel
back_cards.example_en: The Israeli culture is rich with traditions.
An Israeli artist painted the mural.

back_cards.definition_en: Connected to Israeli government or policy
back_cards.example_en: The Israeli embassy hosted a cultural event.
She bought Israeli olives at the market.
The museum showcases Israeli artifacts.

back_cards.definition_en: To respond to a question or message
back_cards.example_en: She will reply to the email this afternoon.
He didn’t reply when asked about his plans.

back_cards.definition_en: To respond to a letter or request
back_cards.example_en: Please reply to the invitation by Friday.

back_cards.definition_en: To react to a comment or post
back_cards.example_en: She loves to reply to comments on her blog.
The company will reply to the complaint soon.

back_cards.definition_en: A dollar in informal American English
back_cards.example_en: The coffee only costs a couple of bucks.

back_cards.definition_en: A male deer or similar animal
back_cards.example_en: A buck was spotted in the forest.
He’s always trying to make a quick buck.

back_cards.definition_en: A unit in casual financial talk
back_cards.example_en: The repair cost him fifty bucks.
The young buck led the team with enthusiasm.

back_cards.definition_en: A tool for cutting with a blade
back_cards.example_en: She used a knife to chop the vegetables.
The chef sharpened his knife before cooking.
The detective found a knife at the scene.
He carried a knife while camping.
The artist used a knife to carve the wood.

back_cards.definition_en: Shaped like a circle or sphere
back_cards.example_en: The table is round and fits six people.

back_cards.definition_en: Describing a complete cycle or set
back_cards.example_en: They played a round game of cards.
The trip cost a round $500.
Her round cheeks glowed with excitement.
The dancers moved in a round pattern.

back_cards.definition_en: Short for technology or technological industry
back_cards.example_en: She works in tech at a startup company.
The store sells the latest tech for gamers.
He’s learning tech to build apps.
Medical tech has improved patient care.
The tech industry is growing rapidly.
The detective solved the mystery quickly.

back_cards.definition_en: A police officer in plain clothes
back_cards.example_en: She works as a detective in the city.
The detective interviewed the witnesses.
He’s a private detective hired for the case.

back_cards.definition_en: A sleuth in stories or media
back_cards.example_en: The book features a clever detective.

back_cards.definition_en: To put items into a container
back_cards.example_en: She will pack her suitcase for the trip.

back_cards.definition_en: To fill or crowd a space
back_cards.example_en: Fans pack the stadium for the game.

back_cards.definition_en: To prepare for travel or moving
back_cards.example_en: They need to pack before the move.
He will pack the snow to build a fort.
She always packs a lunch for work.

back_cards.definition_en: A medical or mental health condition
back_cards.example_en: The doctor diagnosed a sleep disorder.

back_cards.definition_en: A state of confusion or chaos
back_cards.example_en: The protest caused disorder in the streets.
The machine stopped due to a disorder.
The child was treated for an anxiety disorder.
The office was in disorder after the move.

back_cards.definition_en: A living being, often an animal
back_cards.example_en: The forest is home to many creatures.
The story featured a magical creature.
The puppy is such a sweet creature.

back_cards.definition_en: An organism in a natural setting
back_cards.example_en: Marine creatures thrive in the coral reef.

back_cards.definition_en: A being in a creative context
back_cards.example_en: The artist painted a strange creature.

back_cards.definition_en: In a way that is near or similar
back_cards.example_en: She works closely with her team.
He closely examined the document for errors.

back_cards.definition_en: In a tight or intimate manner
back_cards.example_en: The friends stayed closely connected over years.
Their scores were closely matched in the game.
The houses are built closely together.
The city has a large industrial area.
They bought industrial equipment for the factory.
Industrial output increased this year.
The industrial revolution changed society.
Industrial jobs require specific skills.
The city needs more affordable housing.
The charity provides housing for the homeless.
New housing was built near the park.
Housing policies affect urban growth.
The camp offered housing for refugees.
The computer runs on a powerful chip.

back_cards.definition_en: A thin slice of food, like potato
back_cards.example_en: She ate a bag of potato chips.
The cup had a chip on the edge.
He placed a chip on the poker table.
The phone’s chip improves its speed.
She went hiking regardless of the rain.
He continued regardless of the warnings.
They succeeded regardless of the challenges.
The event went on regardless of the delay.
She’ll attend the meeting regardless of her schedule.
The park has numerous trees and flowers.
She received numerous calls about the job.
The book offers numerous examples of grammar.
Numerous species live in the forest.
He faced numerous challenges during the project.
The general gave a command to advance.
She took command of the team.

back_cards.definition_en: A directive in a military context
back_cards.example_en: The soldier followed the captain’s command.

back_cards.definition_en: Mastery or skill in a field
back_cards.example_en: He has a strong command of English.
The program executed the command quickly.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of firing a gun
back_cards.example_en: The police investigated the shooting downtown.

back_cards.definition_en: A filmed scene for a movie
back_cards.example_en: The movie’s shooting took place in the city.
His shooting improved after practice.
The news reported a shooting at the mall.
The shooting for the ad was fun.
She bought a dozen eggs at the store.
He ordered a dozen roses for her.
A dozen people attended the meeting.
The bakery sells donuts by the dozen.

back_cards.definition_en: A collective amount in daily use
back_cards.example_en: She baked a dozen cookies for the party.
She grabbed a pop from the fridge.
The band plays catchy pop songs.
The balloon made a loud pop.
He took a pop at the ball.
Her pop helped fix the car.
She added a layer of frosting to the cake.

back_cards.definition_en: A level or part of something
back_cards.example_en: The painting has a layer of deep meaning.
A layer of snow covered the ground.
The software has a security layer.

back_cards.definition_en: A stratum in a natural setting
back_cards.example_en: The rock layer revealed ancient fossils.

back_cards.definition_en: A staple food made from flour
back_cards.example_en: She baked fresh bread for dinner.

back_cards.definition_en: A food item in daily meals
back_cards.example_en: He made a sandwich with whole-grain bread.
He’s working hard to earn his bread.

back_cards.definition_en: A baked good in various forms
back_cards.example_en: The bakery sells rye bread and baguettes.
Bread is central to many family traditions.

back_cards.definition_en: Something that does not follow a rule
back_cards.example_en: She’s the exception to the strict policy.

back_cards.definition_en: An exclusion from a general case
back_cards.example_en: Everyone attended, with one exception.
This warm winter is an exception.
He took exception to her comment.
The chef’s dish was an exception in quality.
Her passion for music inspires everyone.
Their passion for each other was obvious.

back_cards.definition_en: A deep interest in a hobby
back_cards.example_en: His passion for hiking grew over time.
She spoke with passion about her project.

back_cards.definition_en: Dedication to a cause or goal
back_cards.example_en: His passion for justice drives his work.
The highway connects the city to the coast.
They drove on the highway for hours.
The highway was crowded during rush hour.
Goods are shipped via the highway.
The new highway improved local access.
The water here is pure and safe.
It was a moment of pure joy.
She wore a dress of pure white.
His intentions were pure and honest.
The recipe uses pure vanilla extract.

back_cards.definition_en: A leader in a military unit
back_cards.example_en: The commander led the troops into battle.

back_cards.definition_en: A person in charge of a group
back_cards.example_en: She’s the commander of the rescue team.
The navy commander gave the orders.

back_cards.definition_en: A leader in a specific operation
back_cards.example_en: The mission commander planned the strategy.

back_cards.definition_en: An authority figure in a context
back_cards.example_en: He acted as commander during the crisis.
The storm brought extreme weather conditions.
She has extreme confidence in her skills.
His extreme views surprised everyone.
Extreme sports like skydiving thrill him.

back_cards.definition_en: At the furthest point or limit
back_cards.example_en: They hiked to the extreme edge of the cliff.
Her novel became a popular publication.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of making something public
back_cards.example_en: The publication of the report caused debate.
The library stocks new publications monthly.
His publication was cited in the study.
The newspaper is a daily publication.

back_cards.definition_en: A bad habit or immoral behavior
back_cards.example_en: Smoking was his only vice.
She’s the vice president of the company.
His vice was procrastination under pressure.
The police cracked down on vice in the city.
He serves as vice chair of the committee.

back_cards.definition_en: A man or boy in a casual sense
back_cards.example_en: That fellow over there is my neighbor.
She works with a fellow scientist.

back_cards.definition_en: A member of a group or society
back_cards.example_en: He’s a fellow of the academic institute.

back_cards.definition_en: A person sharing a common interest
back_cards.example_en: They’re fellows in the hiking club.

back_cards.definition_en: A friendly term for a person
back_cards.example_en: The old fellow shared a great story.
